result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Douglas W Haywood was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Douglas W Haywood was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid as a condition of probation from Count 2.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for New Berlin Police Department.  Bail applied to costs/surcharge.  Paid in full.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 1 day was granted.
AMENDED 5/06/2016:  COURT WILL ALLOW, AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THE JAIL SENTENCE BE TRANSFERRED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY AND WILL ALLOW ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.
Consecutive to: Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommenced by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas W Haywood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated

Case called for a motion to modify sentence.  Defendant Douglas W Haywood in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  State objects.  Court will allow, as of August 1, 2016, the jail sentence be transferred to Milwaukee County and will allow Electronic Monitoring.  Judgment of conviction to be amended.
Motion hearing on May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Douglas W Haywood did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff advises his client stated he didn't get notice of today's date.  Attorney Wolff moves for an adjournment.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Sentence, filed by Atty Peter Wolff;   Filed with cover letter dated April 3, 2016
dated March 24, 2016 from Br 3 to Mr. Haywood
dated March 16, 2016 from Douglas Haywood, requesting to be transfered to Milwaukee Co.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Douglas W Haywood in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Count #3 is dismissed outright.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant's finance makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count 1
Sentence of:
300 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 days).  Sentence commences immediately.
FINE:  $4788.00 Bail to be applied, remainder to be paid as a condition of probation from count #2.  
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation from count #2.  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to New Berlin Police Department, to be paid as a condition of probation from count #2.
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through

The Court orders the following:  Count #2. 
Imposed and stayed sentence:
45 days Huber with Standard release conditions, consecutive to count #1.  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Costs:  243.00 waived.
